title: forwarding junk mail from Thunderbird to official govt. reporting site
content:
I'm in the UK, I've been forwarding all my junk email to The National Cyber Security Centre,

https://www.gov.uk/report-suspicious-emails-websites-phishing

I've put their reporting email address into my contacts and have been manually forwarding each junk email as it arrives, they're happy to accept anything suspicious, they say send as much as you like!

https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/collection/phishing-scams/report-scam-email

"If you have received an email which you’re not quite sure about, forward it to report@phishing.gov.uk Forward us as many suspicious emails as you like. Send us emails that feel suspicious, even if you're not certain they're a scam - we can check."

the combination of adding each junk mail senders address to the 'block sender and domain' list in Outlook, plus forwarding each junk mail to the NCSC seems to have completely killed my junk mail problem,

what I'd like to know is: if there is a way of setting up items that arrive in the junk mail folder to automatically forward to this address, or: could a feature be added to Thunderbird where you could set up automatic forwarding of junk, a box where you fill in the appropriate reporting address for your region/country?
creator: spanky.spangler

title: Threading keeps coming back every time I switch it off.
content:
I turn off threading in my inbox. It turns itself back on.

There is a plentiful supply of discussion here about the inept enforced threading which happened on an update. There is a lot of info on turning it off with view ->sort-> etc etc.

But it turns itself back on.

Threading is ghastly, I don't ever want to see it, but accepting that someone somewhere likes it, at least make sure that when it is turned off it stays off.

Horrible.
creator: WellTired

creator: trendfox1

title: Group By Sort breaks sorting by date
content:
I switched to Thunderbird 115 Supernova a couple of months ago. All was well for some weeks, but then a weird problem developed.

I've always used Group By Sort, a huge help in organizing my endless flow of email. But now, when I enable Group By Sort, Thunderbird randomly mixes new and old messages - the list shows recent messages from 2023, then skips to 2022, then goes back to 2023 again. (See attached image.) I can't see any pattern to it. This problem affects all my email folders and sub-folders.

I've tried all the obvious things - changing sort direction and column, using Repair Folder from the Properties dialog, etc. My only fallback at this point is to use Unthreaded view, which seems to sort correctly.

Needless to say, this is incredibly annoying. I was hoping Supernova would improve my life, instead it seems to have broken one of my favorite features. (My last resort will be to revert to pre-Supernova Thunderbird... if that's even possible.)

I've searched up and down the Internet, can't find any discussion of this problem. Can anyone help with this?
creator: f_lenk

title: Stále dotazování na přihlašovací údaje při používání O365 účtu přes POP3, způsob ověřování OAuth
content: Zdravím, prosím o pomoc, máme poštovní účet O365 a v Thunderbirdu nastaven protokol POP3, ověřování přes OAuth, jedna emailová adresa se používá na více PC. Účet je nastaven tak, aby zprávy zůstávaly na serveru a jednotliví uživatelé měli stejné emaily a každý si mazal co potřebuje. Problém je v tom, že stále, po nějaké chvíli vyskakuje okno pro přihlášení, ověření k O365, i když dáme zapamatovat přihlašovací údaje, toto je velice otravné a nepříjemné :( Občas se také děje to, že se účet úplně odhlásí a nevyskočí žádné hlášení. O365 jsou nastaveny dle doporučení z tohoto webu. Všem moc díky za případné rady.
creator: rogerin81

title: Still asking for login credentials when using O365 account via POP3, OAuth authentication method
content: Hi, please help, we have an O365 mail account and in Thunderbird we have POP3 protocol set up, authentication via OAuth, one email address is used on multiple PCs. The account is set up so that messages stay on the server and individual users have the same emails and everyone deletes what they need. The problem is that still, after a while, a window pops up for login, authentication to O365, even if we put the login credentials in memory, this is very annoying and annoying :( Sometimes it also happens that the account completely logs out and no message pops up. O365 are set up as recommended from this site. Thank you all very much for any advice.

title: Problems using version 115.5.0
content:
Issue 1: When using the scroll bar to browse the list of emails, it skips one email (advances too much), so when searching I sometimes cannot find that email. I tried resizing the list of emails to try to match the vertical size, but it does not seem to help.

Issue 2: I cannot customize the vertical size for the list of emails. It won't accept reducing less than about one third of the vertical size of the thunderbird window.

Issue 3: In between the list of emails and the display of the current email content, there is a large area that I find redundant. The 'From', 'To', 'Subject', 'Date' is redundant since the list of emails already show all this information. I cannot find a way to remove, minimize or compact this region. Even the list of buttons could be removed in my case since I mainly use shortcuts and anyway, they are available in the menu or when you right click on an email.

title: Thunderbird (various versions) Hangs on opening in Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS after latest updates
content:
After applying the latest updates to Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS today, I find that ThunderBird will load and then enter a busy state where the system asks if I want to terminate or wait for ThunderBird.

After waiting quite some time, it is apparent that perhaps it is in vain. I have tried a few different versions: The initially installed: 115.5.0 The latest: 121.0b1 and previous: 115.4.3

All seem to exhibit similar behavior with my previously working profile.

The program loads, the preview screen draws, an open tab appears to try to load, and a few seconds after launch, things hang up.

Anyone else noticing issues?
creator: cl1

title: View / Sort By / Unthreaded will not stick.
content: I am currently on Thunderbird v115.5.0. Ever since v115 came out I am unable to make my Inbox stay unthreaded. This is absolutely maddening, as I have to repeat this many times each day. Can anyone tell me how to make Unthreaded view stick on my Inbox? I'd like to stick with Thunderbird, as I've been using for almost 20 years, but I simply cannot continue to waste so much time on it.

title: mail sent with invalid address now completely lost, not amused
content:
spent a long time typing a complex mail, and due to the way the new version (115.5.0) does things, the outgoing address had a . on the end of it that wasn't visible, because it was obscured by a note that the send address wasn't in the address book, For years, I've had used BCC to get a copy back into my inbox, but now, with this latest version, if the send fails, it also doesn't forward the copy, so a mail that took over an hour to create is now lost due to the failure of the system, before now, a fail due to invalid address returned the item, so at least the body of the mail wasn't lost.

NOT impressed, this means I now have to change my system in order to not lose items by using the BCC option, it meant I knew that the server had processed the mail, now, I've no way to be sure it has truly been sent.
creator: sgarry1
